Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns

Class TupleConsumer

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleConsumer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpPOST
public abstract class TupleConsumer extends AbstractOperator
Abstract pattern class for an operator that consumes tuples and does not produce an output stream. Incoming tuples are processed in batches, driven by the size of the batch and a timeout. A batch is processed when it reaches at least getBatchSize() or at least getBatchTimeout() time have passed since the first tuple was added to the batch.

The batch is processed by the processBatch provided by a concrete sub-class.
Processing of the batch is asynchronous with incoming tuples.

A batch size of 1 (the default) is not treated specially, in this case each incoming tuple may start batch processing meaning that all processing of the tuple in processBatch() is handled asynchronously with other tuple arrival.

Note that there is no requirement to use this class to implement a sink style operator.

    • getBatchSize

      public final int getBatchSize()
      Get the batch size.
      Returns:
      Current batch size, defaults to 1 if setBatchSize() has not been called.

    • setBatchSize

      @Parameter(optional=true, description="Set the batch size.") public void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
      Set the current batch size. If least batchSize tuples are currently batched then batch processing will be initiated asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      batchSize - New batch size, must be one or greater.

    • getBatchTimeout

      public final long getBatchTimeout()
      Get the batch timeout value.
      Returns:
      Current batch timeout, defaults to 0 (no timeout) if setBatchTimeout has not been called.

    • setBatchTimeout

      public final void setBatchTimeout(long batchTimeout, TimeUnit unit)
      Set the batch timeout. The batch timeout is the amount of time the operator will wait after the first tuple in the batch before processing the batch. For example with a batch size of 100 and a timeout of two seconds a batch will be processed when whichever comes first out of 100 tuples are in the batch or 2 seconds have passed since the first tuple was added.
      This method should be made at initialization time, within the initialize method. Calling it once tuples are being received and batched may have unpredictable effects. A timeout of 0 means no timeout.
      Parameters:
      batchTimeout - Timeout value
      unit - Unit of the timeout value

    • processBatch

      protected abstract boolean processBatch(Queue<TupleConsumer.BatchedTuple> batch) throws Exception
      Process a batch of tuples. This call is made asynchronously with incoming tuples and tuples that arrive after this processing was initiated will not be added to set defined by the passed in collection batch. Such tuples will be processed in a future batch.
      The expected case is that this method will process all tuples in the batch, but a mechanism exists to allow a subset of tuples to be processed in a future batch. If this method returns true any tuples remaining in the passed in collection are added into a future batch. If false is returned then it is assumed that all tuples have been processed and none will processed in the future.
      No assumptions should be made about the number of tuples in the passed in collection batch, it may be less than, equal to or greater than the current batch size.
      If tuple arrival order is not being preserved then this method may be called concurrently by multiple threads (with different batches) and thus needs to be thread safe.
      Parameters:
      batch - Batch of tuples to be processed, its contents are not modified by any incoming tuples.
      Returns:
      True process any tuples left in batch in a future batch, false no tuples are added back for future processing.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • setPreserveOrder

      public final void setPreserveOrder(boolean preserveOrder)
      Set if order of tuples is preserved in the batch and in the calls to processBatch. If set to true then no concurrent calls will be made to processBatch.
      This method should be made at initialization time, within the initialize method. Calling it once tuples are being received and batched may have unpredictable effects.
      Parameters:
      preserveOrder - True to preserve order, false to not care about ordering.

    • isPreserveOrder

      public final boolean isPreserveOrder()
      True if arrival order is to be preserved when processing tuples.
      Returns:
      True if arrival order is to be preserved.

    • getBatchTimeoutUnit

      public TimeUnit getBatchTimeoutUnit()
